title: Why Can't I?
description: In Why Can't I? Jose wants to know why he can't do things he thinks are fun. Mom says his fun needs to be safe. Will Jose find something safe and fun to do? Students will have the opportunity to make inferences and draw conclusions as well as ask and answer questions as they read this engaging book. Detailed illustrations, repetitive text, and high-frequency words support emergent readers.
meta: climb, dance, jump, kitchen, paint, shelves, slide, wash
Use the reading strategy of asking and answering questions to understand text
Make Inferences/Draw Conclusions : Make inferences/Draw conclusions
Segment Onset and Rime : Segment onset and rime
Question Marks : Recognize and use question marks
Concept Words : Recognize and use question words

Promote higher-order thinking for small groups
or whole class
